data.title: How many teams have played in the Premier League? All teams, history and list of champions
data.meta_description: The list of Premier League winners, those never to be relegated and the full number of clubs to have participated in the English top flight since 1992/93.
data.text:
Since the 1992/93 season, the Premier League's name has become synonymous with the highest quality English football.

From the Manchester United teams of the 1990s and 2000s managed by Sir Alex Ferguson, to battles between Arsene Wenger and Jose Mourinho, to the recent era dominated by Pep Guardiola's Manchester City, it's always made for captivating viewing.

There are some stalwarts of the division who are always there. But the promotion and relegation format means plenty from lower down the pyramid have earned themselves the chance to savour the Premier League's riches.

The Sporting News details the history of all Premier League teams right here, and how often each have competed in it.

MORE: Total Premier League titles won by Man United, City, Chelsea, Arsenal and Liverpool

How many teams have played in the Premier League?

From the start of the Premier League in 1992 up to the 2022/23 season, 50 clubs have participated in the competition.

A total of 12 of the 20 teams who lined up for the 2022/23 campaign were 'founder' clubs and involved in that first 1992/93 season.

MORE: Watch every Premier League match in Canada on Fubo

Full list of teams in Premier League history

Current Premier League teams (who played in 2022/23 season) marked in italics.

Team name Last season in Premier League Total number of seasons* Arsenal 22/23 31 Chelsea 22/23 31 Everton 22/23 31 Liverpool 22/23 31 Manchester United 22/23 31 Tottenham 22/23 31 Aston Villa 22/23 28 Newcastle 22/23 28 West Ham 22/23 27 Manchester City 22/23 26 Southampton 22/23 24 Blackburn 11/12 18 Leicester 22/23 17 Fulham 22/23 16 Sunderland 16/17 16 Leeds 22/23 15 Middlesbrough 16/17 15 Crystal Palace 22/23 14 West Brom 20/21 13 Bolton 11/12 13 Stoke 17/18 10 Norwich 21/22 10 Coventry 00/01 9 Wolves 22/23 9 Burnley 21/22 8 Sheffield Wednesday 99/00 8 Wigan 12/13 8 Wimbledon 99/00 8 Charlton 06/07 8 Watford 21/22 8 Portsmouth 09/10 7 Swansea 17/18 7 Derby 07/08 7 Birmingham 10/11 7 QPR 14/15 7 Brighton 22/23 6 Bournemouth 22/23 6 Nottingham Forest 22/23 6 Sheffield United 20/21 5 Ipswich 01/02 5 Hull 16/17 5 Reading 12/13 3 Brentford 22/23 2 Bradford 00/01 2 Huddersfield 18/19 2 Oldham 93/94 2 Cardiff 18/19 2 Barnsley 97/98 1 Blackpool 10/11 1 Swindon 93/94 1

*Not including the 2023/24 campaign, despite achieving Premier League safety or Championship promotion in 22/23 to ensure their place in the next season.

Luton Town will become the newest – and a 51st club to play in the Premier League – after they beat Coventry in the Championship playoff final.

How many teams have won the Premier League?

Only seven clubs – Manchester United, Manchester City, Chelsea, Arsenal, Liverpool, Leicester and Blackburn – have ever lifted the trophy in the past 30 years.

The likes of Newcastle, Aston Villa and Tottenham have come close without ever winning it outright.

List of Premier League football champions

Season Premier League winner Manager 1992/93 Manchester United Sir Alex Ferguson 1993/94 Manchester United Sir Alex Ferguson 1994/95 Blackburn Rovers Kenny Dalglish 1995/96 Manchester United Sir Alex Ferguson 1996/97 Manchester United Sir Alex Ferguson 1997/98 Arsenal Arsene Wenger 1998/99 Manchester United Sir Alex Ferguson 1999/2000 Manchester United Sir Alex Ferguson 2000/01 Manchester United Sir Alex Ferguson 2001/02 Arsenal Arsene Wenger 2002/03 Manchester United Sir Alex Ferguson 2003/04 Arsenal Arsene Wenger 2004/05 Chelsea Jose Mourinho 2005/06 Chelsea Jose Mourinho 2006/07 Manchester United Sir Alex Ferguson 2007/08 Manchester United Sir Alex Ferguson 2008/09 Manchester United Sir Alex Ferguson 2009/10 Chelsea Carlo Ancelotti 2010/11 Manchester United Sir Alex Ferguson 2011/12 Manchester City Roberto Mancini 2012/13 Manchester United Sir Alex Ferguson 2013/14 Manchester City Manuel Pellegrini 2014/15 Chelsea Jose Mourinho 2015/16 Leicester City Claudio Ranieri 2016/17 Chelsea Antonio Conte 2017/18 Manchester City Pep Guardiola 2018/19 Manchester City Pep Guardiola 2019/20 Liverpool Jurgen Klopp 2020/21 Manchester City Pep Guardiola 2021/22 Manchester City Pep Guardiola 2022/23 Manchester City Pep Guardiola

Which teams have never been relegated from the Premier League?

Everton came dangerously close to being relegated this year, staying up on the last day, but they remain among an elite group of clubs to have never been relegated from the Premier League.

Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool, Manchester United and Tottenham are the others.

Before the Premier League era, Everton have the second-longest tenure in English top flight history, with only Arsenal maintaining their top-flight status for longer. Arsenal have been a top-tier club in every season since the 1919/20 campaign.

Everton – last relegated in 1950/51 – have been in the top tier for longer than Liverpool (since 1962/63), Manchester United (1975/76), Tottenham (1978/79), and Chelsea (1989/90).
